item.title: Elmfield Road potholes, 1st July
item.description:
Please can you look at Elmfield Road from the start to the end of the road by the park. It is so bumpy and needs resurfacing. It was on the list to be resurfaced in 24/25 but I cannot see it there now. Thankyou
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 11, Elmfield Road, Wymans Brook, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Hedge and brambles over hanging footpath, 1st July
item.description:
On the footpath leading from Cox's there are numerous places where the hedgerow is overhanging the footpath. This includes brambles which is a hazard for both pedestrians and cyclists.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Numerous potholes/ crumbling road surface, 1st July
item.description:
This stretch of New Road is about 50 yards from the junction with Two Hedges Road and Gambles Lane. The road falls away and the surface is studded with holes, previously repaired, and the surface is crumbling. It is not possible to safely avoid this if there is oncoming traffic. The entire stretch requires urgent and proper fixing.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): New Road, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Green or amber traffic light is not working problem, 1st July
item.description:
Customer reports that, starting this morning, the traffic lights no longer appear to be working "intelligently", meaning that they only let 2 or 3 cars through on the main B4063 before cycling back to red, causing very large traffic buildup. Concerned there may be an issue with the sensors.
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Green or amber traffic light is not working

item.title: The traffic lights at this junction between Cheltenham Road East and Down Hatherley Lane are fitted with louvres, presumably so that only the appropriate line of traffic can see them. The angle of the louvres is badly out, so that the light can hardly be seen at all. Coming through this junction this morning from the Cheltenham direction a motorhome started to pull out of Down Hatherley Lane in front of me. I believe I had a green light, but it wasn't easy to see. Perhaps the motorhome also thought they had a green., 1st July
item.description:
Traffic lights at the junction between Cheltenham Road East and Down Hatherley Lane. There is a similar problem with the louvres on the adjacent set of traffic lights at the Meteor Business Park Entrance. This problem has existed since major works were done to remodel the junction - maybe two years ago?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road East, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Traffic light head is facing wrong direction
